Package core

Interface HlaWorld

  • public interface HlaWorld
    Interface used get to all functions within a HLA Federation.

    Generated by Pitch Developer Studio version 6.2.0
    Licensed to Guidarly Joseph, SEE, Project Edition

    This class is ThreadSafe as defined by Java Concurrency in Practice, see jcip.net.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  HlaWorld.ExceptionListener
      An ExceptionListener is notified of internal exceptions.
      static class  HlaWorld.Factory
      Factory used to create an instance of the HlaWorld.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        HlaLogicalTime connect()
                throws HlaConnectException,
                       HlaInvalidLicenseException,
                       HlaFomException,
                       HlaRtiException,
                       HlaInternalException,
                       HlaNotConnectedException,
                       HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException,
                       HlaSaveInProgressException,
                       HlaRestoreInProgressException,
                       HlaNormalizerException
        Connect to a federation. This will connect to the RTI, join and preform publish and subscribe HLA calls. The name of the federation, the CRC location and other settings are defined in the settings supplied to HlaWorld.Factory.create()
        Returns:
        the logical time for the current frame.
        Throws:
        HlaConnectException - if failed to connect to the RTI
        HlaInvalidLicenseException - if the license is not valid
        HlaFomException - if the FOM is not correct
        HlaRtiException - if there are RTI related problems
        HlaInternalException - if there are internal problems
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate was disconnected during initialization
        HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException - if step size or lookahead from HlaSettings is invalid
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress
        HlaNormalizerException - if all Normalizers are not set

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
         throws HlaFederateOwnsAttributeException,
                HlaRtiException,
                HlaInternalException
        Disconnect from the federation.
        Throws:
        HlaFederateOwnsAttributeException - if ownership acquisitions are pending or if attributes are owned and this not handled by the resign action
        HlaRtiException - if there are RTI related problems
        HlaInternalException - if there are internal problems

      • enableTimeManagement

        boolean enableTimeManagement()
                      throws HlaRtiException,
                             HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException,
                             HlaInternalException,
                             HlaNotConnectedException
        Enable time management. The federate will become regulating and/or constrained based on the settings objects supplied on create. For this method to have any effect, the tuning flag ENABLE_TIME_MANAGEMENT_ON_CONNECT must be false. Note that this method will do nothing if constrained and regulating are false in settings. Note that this method will do nothing if time management is already enabled, i.e. calling this multiple times has no effect.
        Returns:
        true if time management was enabled, otherwise false
        Throws:
        HlaRtiException - if there are RTI related problems
        HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException - if step size or lookahead from HlaSettings is invalid
        HlaInternalException - if there are internal problems
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate was disconnected during initialization

      • advanceToNextFrame

        HlaLogicalTime advanceToNextFrame()
                           throws HlaRtiException,
                                  HlaInternalException,
                                  HlaNotConnectedException,
                                  HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException,
                                  HlaInTimeAdvancingStateException,
                                  HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                  HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Advance the logical time to the next frame. This will perform the Time Advance Request HLA call. Note that this method does not support 0-lookahead, use advanceToNextEvent() instead. Note that this method is an implicit evokeAll() in manual evoke mode, to verify that all notifications for the previous time has been processed before advancing to the next frame.
        Returns:
        the logical time for the new, now current, frame.
        Throws:
        HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException - if the logical time is not valid
        HlaInTimeAdvancingStateException - if the federate is in the time advancing state already
        HlaRtiException - if there are RTI related problems
        HlaInternalException - if there are internal problems
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate was disconnected during initialization
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • advanceToNextEvent

        HlaLogicalTime advanceToNextEvent()
                           throws HlaRtiException,
                                  HlaInternalException,
                                  HlaNotConnectedException,
                                  HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException,
                                  HlaInTimeAdvancingStateException,
                                  HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                  HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Advance the logical time to the next event or, if no events are available, to the next frame. This will perform the Next Message Request Available HLA call. This method support 0-lookahead so that messages may be sent with the same logical time as the federate has advanced to. Note that this method is an implicit evokeAll() in manual evoke mode, to verify that all notifications for the previous time has been processed before advancing to the next event.
        Returns:
        the logical time for the new, now current, frame.
        Throws:
        HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException - if the logical time is not valid
        HlaInTimeAdvancingStateException - if the federate is in the time advancing state already
        HlaRtiException - if there are RTI related problems
        HlaInternalException - if there are internal problems
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate was disconnected during initialization
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • advanceToLogicalTime

        HlaLogicalTime advanceToLogicalTime​(HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
                             throws HlaRtiException,
                                    HlaInternalException,
                                    HlaNotConnectedException,
                                    HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException,
                                    HlaInTimeAdvancingStateException,
                                    HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                    HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Advance to the specified logical time. This will preform the Time Advance Request HLA call. Note that this method is an implicit evokeAll() in manual evoke mode, to verify that all notifications for the previous time has been processed before advancing to the new time.
        Parameters:
        logicalTime - desired new logical time
        Returns:
        the logical time for the new, now current, frame.
        Throws:
        HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException - if the logical time is not valid
        HlaInTimeAdvancingStateException - if the federate is in the time advancing state already
        HlaRtiException - if there are RTI related problems
        HlaInternalException - if there are internal problems
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate was disconnected during initialization
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • invokeWhenGranted

        void invokeWhenGranted​(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Invoke this runnable when in the granted state.

        The runnable is invoked directly on this thread if the federate is in the granted state, otherwise the runnable will be invoked when the federate is granted. Note that the federate can not enter the advancing state until the runnable has completed.

        Parameters:
        runnable - to be invoked when granted

      • getCurrentLogicalTime

        HlaLogicalTime getCurrentLogicalTime()
        Get the logical time for the current frame. This is the same as current logical time in the RTI. Updated when a new time is granted by the RTI.
        Returns:
        the logical time for the current frame.

      • getNextLogicalTime

        HlaLogicalTime getNextLogicalTime()
        Get the logical time for the next frame. Updated when a new time is granted by the RTI to granted time + step size.
        Returns:
        the logical time for the next frame.

      • getDefaultSendTime

        HlaLogicalTime getDefaultSendTime()
        Get the next logical time that is valid to use for sending events. This is usually same as next logical time. Updated to next logical time + look-ahead when advancing, and updated to granted time + look-ahead when granted.
        Returns:
        the next valid logical time that is valid to use for sending events.

      • createLogicalTime

        HlaLogicalTime createLogicalTime​(long value)
        Create a new logical time with the supplied value.
        Parameters:
        value - value to use
        Returns:
        the new logical time with the supplied value.

      • getEncodedHlaFederateHandle

        byte[] getEncodedHlaFederateHandle()
        Get the encoded HLA federate handle for this federate.
        Returns:
        the encoded HLA federate handle for this federate, or null if not joined.

      • peek

        int peek()
        Gives the number of pending notifications.
        Returns:
        the number of pending notifications.

      • evoke

        void evoke()
        Evokes a single notification from the notification queue. The notification will be called from this thread. This method will return after the notification has returned. If there are no pending notifications, this method will return immediately. If this HlaWorld is in auto evoke mode, this method will be a no op. Exceptions thrown in the user notification code will be posted to the ExceptionListener.

      • evokeAll

        void evokeAll()
        Evokes all pending notifications from the notification queue. The notifications will be called from this thread, one at a time. This method returns when the notification queue is empty. Exceptions thrown in the user notification code will be posted to the ExceptionListener. If this HlaWorld is in auto evoke mode, this method will be a no op.

      • evokeAll

        void evokeAll​(long millis)
        Evokes notifications for at least millis milliseconds with this thread. If all pending notifications are processed before millis milliseconds have elapsed, the current thread is suspended until either some more notifications arrive, or the time has elapsed. Note that this method could return even when there are pending notifications left. If this HlaWorld is in auto evoke mode, this will suspend the current thread until the time has elapsed. Exceptions thrown in the user notification code will be posted to the ExceptionListener.
        Parameters:
        millis - The minimum time, in ms, to process notifications.

      • disableNotifications

        void disableNotifications()
        Disable automatic invocations of notifications. No new notifications will be invoked after disableNotifications() has returned. Note that notifications has to be manually enabled once disabled. This can be done with the following code: 
        
 _hlaWorld.disableNotifications();
 try {
    //perform task that generates notifications that can not be handled until after this block
 } finally {
   _hlaWorld.enableNotifications();
 }
        If this HlaWorld is in manual evoke mode, this method will be a no op.

      • enableNotifications

        void enableNotifications()
        Enable automatic invocations of notifications. Note that the HlaWorld is started in the enabled state, so notifications has to be disabled first before this function has any effect. If this HlaWorld is in manual evoke mode, this method will be a no op.

      • setExceptionListener

        void setExceptionListener​(HlaWorld.ExceptionListener exceptionListener)
        Sets the exception handler for this HlaWorld to exceptionListener. The exception handler is notified when this HlaWorld catches exceptions.
        Parameters:
        exceptionListener - The exception handler for this HlaWorld, if null the default exception listener will be used.
